comments: He\'s super chill, but you don\'t learn ANYTHING in his class. He leaves out a lot of details while teaching & just assumes that you know what\'s going on. On the plus side, you\'re allowed to use the internet during the tests. He also posts all of his old exams and notes on his website. He\'s good to take if you just need ochem1 for your bio degree

comments: Took this as the intro course for the E&S minor. Really great introduction to E&S. Attendance is not mandatory but lectures are very informative and enjoyable. HUGE group project so be prepared to work. Not an easy A course. 3 tests all open internet but extremely difficult and not normal questions you can just google. Great course!

comments: Took him for intro to energy and sustainability. Interesting lecturer and good looking too! Just take notes during his lectures and use old posted material for the tests. No final exam, just a final group project that the TA Jami completely handles. Online 4 question attendance quizzes after each class. Two extra credit opps also.

comments: This class is a great class if you are interested in the energy industry. The group project will take you forever. So get a jump on it asap!!! The key to success in this class is taking good notes, and a good team for the group project. He never answers emails, but the TA does. Do not buy the books. It is a waste of money. We never used them

comments: Good professor. Although if you plan on taking ochem 2, he does not prepare you well for it. He had us use the internet so memorization of the reactions was not necessary, but it is for the ACS exam which you will take if you need to take ochem 2 (so any premeds). Dr. Bean is in my opinion better.

comments: Super hard class. BUT he is a very nice guy and gives great lectures, I actually enjoyed going to his class a lot, but OCHEM is tough, so prepare before heading to class, he has a webpage with online lectures, use it. But if you can avoid him, then do it, his tests are extremely hard.
